info.title: Online Shop - REST API Docs
info.description:
# Online Shop REST API This document describes the REST API for [online shop](https://webshop.one.com). The API can be used to develop new apps or integrations for the online shop. # Authentication The REST API uses bearer authentication method. In this authentication method the API user must send the JWT token provided by the Online Shop in the `Authorization` request header while accessing any REST API endpoint. Authorization request header ``` Authorization: Bearer ``` # Get the authentication token You can get the [authentication token](#section/Authentication) by adding an app to your [online shop](https://webshop.one.com). 1. Login to your [online shop](https://webshop.one.com) 2. Create a URL with the query params as shown below and paste it in the browser. ``` https://webshop.one.com/apps?clientId=&clientSecret=&name=&description=&redirectUrl=&supportEmail=&supportPhone=&supportLink=&logoImageUrl=&disconnectUrl=&helpLink=&createAccountLink=&accessKey=&configurationEndPoint=&isConfigurationRequiredEndPoint= ``` 3. You will be presented with a dialog to accept or cancel adding new of app, once you accept to add the new app then online shop will redirect you to the `redirectUrl` (from the provided query params) with an `instant-token`. 4. Use the `instant-token` to get the actual API token from the [API-token end point](#tag/AUTH/paths/~1auth~1token~1new/post). 5. Once you have the actual API token you can validate it at the [token validation end point](#tag/AUTH/paths/~1api~1v2~1auth~1token~1validate/post). 6. Securely preserve the API token to access the REST API or [renew](#tag/AUTH/paths/~1api~1v2~1auth~1token~1renew/post) your token. #### List of URL query params | **Query param name** | **Required or Optional** | **Description - example** | | ---------------------|--------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | clientId | required | A unique Id for your App. Example: com.example | | clientSecret | required | A secret key for your App. Example: some-secret-key | | name | required | Name of your App. Example: Acme corp. App | | description | required | Description of your App. Example: Show your products in social media portal | | redirectUrl | required | A link to receive instant-token. Example: https://example.com/connect-app | | supportEmail | optional | A support email address for your app. Example: support@example.com | | supportPhone | optional | A support phone number for your app. Example: +012345678 | | supportLink | optional | A link describing support information for your app. Example: https://example.com/support| | logoImageUrl | required | A link to your App logo. Example: https://example.com/logo.png | | disconnectUrl | optional | A link to receive-notification-when-disconnected | | helpLink | optional | A link to help page of your App | | createAccountLink | optional | A link for user to create an account in your app | | accessKey | optional | A secret key to access your App | configurationEndPoint | optional | A end point to redirect once your app is connected | isConfigurationRequiredEndPoint | optional | to determine whether configuration end point is required *names are case sensitive* ### The authentication token expires after 72 hours. Please use the [renew token end point](#tag/AUTH/paths/~1auth~1token~1renew/post) to get a renewed token. # General errors These errors are common to all endpoints. These errors are returned when shop subscription is expired, or when shop is deactivated, or suspsended or shop is under maintenance mode. | HTTP code | Error name | Description | | --------- | ---------- | ----------- | | 401 | Unauthorized | The request is missing a valid authentication token. | | 403 | Forbidden | The request is not allowed. | | 404 | Not Found | The requested resource was not found. | | 500 | Internal Server Error | An internal server error occurred. | | 404 | DomainNotCreated | Shop is deleted or not yet created | | 503 | MAINTENANCE | Shop is in maintenance mode. | | 402 | PaymentRequired | Shop subscription is deactivated or not paid. | | 503 | SUSPENDED | Shop subscription is suspended. | # Contacts [Contacts - REST API Docs](https://oneconnect.public-default.live1-k8s-cph3.one.com/api/v1/docs) Note: This link takes you to an external resource that is not part of this documentation. # Custom Payments Integration This guide will help you integrate custom payment methods and utilize them to create orders. > Authentication: Ensure you have a valid authentication token obtained from the server using the [authentication token](#section/Get-the-authentication-token) ## Prerequisite Before proceed with the integration, it's essential to understand the following terms: * **Custom Payment:** New payment to be integrated. * **Custom Subpayment:** A subtype of custom payment methods, such as 'cards', 'bank', and 'wallet'. Each subpayment method should be associated with one custom payment method. * **Payment app developer:** The one who is integrating the custom payment with the system * **Custom subpayment Name:** This serves as a unique identifier for each subpayment method, formed by combining the payment method name and subpayment method with an underscore (_). For instance, if the payment method name is `A` and the subpayment method is `card`, the custom subpayment name will be `A_card`. * **Order Intent:** Refers to the intention behind a customer's action to place an order. A unique order intent will be created during the [Create an order](#tag/STOREFRONT-ORDER/paths/~1storefront~1order/post) request * **Order Intent Key:** A unique identifier associated with each order intent. * **Process payment api:** This API is responsible for managing the redirection from the payment gateway or from the Payment app developer, as well as processing payments. Upon successful processing by this API, an order will be created. The API accepts two query parameters. 1. paymentStatus: This parameter indicates the status of the payment and can have values "success" or "failure". 2. redirectUrl: This parameter specifies a valid URL to which the server will redirect once it processes the request. * **Instant Payment:** A payment method enabling immediate transaction processing and completion, typically offering instant payment confirmation. If the custom payment method is instant, orders will be created and captured instantly following successful redirection from the payment gateway. * **Delayed Payment:** This refers to a payment method where the server must await webhooks to update the payment status. If an order is created with a delayed payment method, the `process payment API` request will only create the order without marking it as captured. The server will wait for the payment success or failure webhook event to update the status accordingly. * **Checkout URL:** During the addition of [custom payment methods](#tag/CUSTOM-PAYMENTS/paths/~1payments/post), the Checkout URL should be provided in the URL section. Payment app developers can use this URL to initiate an intent/order within the gateway with each request made during the order creation process. * **Verify URL:** The verification URL should also be provided in the designated URL section. Upon each request made to this URL, app developers can return the status of the payment checkout. Accepted values include "COMPLETED" or "FAILED". - **COMPLETED**: Signifies the completion of the checkout flow. - **FAILED**: Indicates either the user canceled the checkout flow or an unexpected issue occurred. * **Capture URL:** This URL is optional for [custom payment methods](#tag/CUSTOM-PAYMENTS/paths/~1payments/post) and is only required if the gateway chooses to handle payment capture programmatically after the checkout process is completed. The server will invoke this API subsequent to its call to the verify URL, provided that the status returned is COMPLETED. * **Refund URL:** The refund URL should also be provided in the designated URL section. Upon each request made to this URL, app developers can submit a refund request in the gateway. The Server will wait for the refund success/failure event on [payment webhook](#tag/CUSTOM-PAYMENTS/paths/~1storefront~1webhook~1payment/post) api to update the refund status in the database. * **SuccessCallback:** This is the URL to be provided in the [Create an order](#tag/STOREFRONT-ORDER/paths/~1storefront~1order/post) request, determining the page that the user should be directed to upon successful payment completion. * **CancelCallback:** This is the URL to be provided in the [Create an order](#tag/STOREFRONT-ORDER/paths/~1storefront~1order/post) request, determining the page that the user should be directed to after a failed payment attempt. ## Step 1: Adding and Updating Custom Payment Methods. Add and update custom payment and sub payments methods using below apis. * [Add custom Payment](#tag/CUSTOM-PAYMENTS/paths/~1payments/post) * [Update custom Payment](#tag/CUSTOM-PAYMENTS/paths/~1payments~1:paymentId/put) * [Add custom sub payment](tag/CUSTOM-PAYMENTS/paths/~1payments/post) * [Update custom sub payment](#tag/CUSTOM-PAYMENTS/paths/~1payments~1sub/post) ## Step 2: Creating a New Order 1. Use the [Create an order](#tag/STOREFRONT-ORDER/paths/~1storefront~1order/post) api with the custom subpayment name as the `transactionType`. Retrieve the subpayment name using the [Get custom Payment](#tag/CUSTOM-PAYMENTS/paths/~1payments~1:paymentId/get).
This api will generate a temporary order, retrievable using the [order intent key](#tag/STOREFRONT-ORDER/paths/~1storefront~1order~1:orderIntentKey/get). A valid order will only be created once the user completes the checkout flow. ## Step 3: Processing the Order 1. During order request processing,The server initiates a call to the checkout URL provided during custom payment addition ([Add custom payment](#tag/CUSTOM-PAYMENTS/paths/~1payments/post)).
Payment app developers can use this api call to initiate an intent/order within the gateway.

Request format: ``` method: POST Payload { "orderIntentKey": "string", "callbacks": { "successUrl": "string", "cancelUrl": "string" } } ``` - ***orderIntentKey:*** Use this to get order details using [Get shop order](#tag/STOREFRONT-ORDER/paths/~1storefront~1order~1:orderIntentKey/get) API. - ***callbacks:*** These are intended to be submitted to the payment gateway as the success and failure/cancel URLs. - ***successUrl*** : This will be [Process payment](#tag/CUSTOM-PAYMENTS/paths/~1storefront~1process-payment/get) API endpoint with` paymentStatus=success` and `redirectUrl=successCallback` parameters, as provided in the create order request. - ***cancelUrl*** : This will be [Process payment](#tag/CUSTOM-PAYMENTS/paths/~1storefront~1process-payment/get) API endpoint with` paymentStatus=failure` and `redirectUrl=cancelCallback` parameters, as provided in the create order request. 3. It expects a response containing the gateway chekout page url(`redirectUrl`) and unique identifier for each chekout request(`transactionId`).
Expected response format: ``` { "data": { "redirectUrl": "string", "transactionId": "string" } } ``` >If the payment gateway only allows for a single callback URL during order/intent creation, or if the gateway provides the status through an additional API call, it becomes the responsibility of the payment developer to verify the status and redirect it to the process payment URL.
In these situations, developers should refrain from providing the callback URLs provided in the `checkout` request to the gateway. Instead, they should provide their own endpoint to handle the redirection directly and subsequently redirect it to the success or cancel URL provided in the checkout API payload based on the obtained status.
Additionally, the success or cancel URL can be dynamically generated as needed.
Eg:If the payment gateway return success/failure in the status then reidrect the request to process-payment-api?paymentStatus=success/failure&redirectUrl=successCallback/cancelCallback ## Step 4: Handle the Create an order response 1. Utilize the redirectUrl provided in the [Create an order](#tag/STOREFRONT-ORDER/paths/~1storefront~1order/post) response to guide the user to the checkout page. [Create an order](#tag/STOREFRONT-ORDER/paths/~1storefront~1order/post) Response format: ``` { "status": "Success", "data": { "redirectUrl": "string", //the redirectUrl obtained from the checkout url. "transactionId": "string", //the transactionId obtained from the checkout url. "orderIntentKey": "string" } } ``` ## Step 5: Payment Completion and Verification:(user completed/cancelled the checkout) 1. After the user completes or cancels the checkout, the payment gateway redirects them to the [Process payment](#tag/CUSTOM-PAYMENTS/paths/~1storefront~1process-payment/get) URL provided by the app developer during order/intent creation in the gateway. 2. The server perform the following operation during this step. - Verify: Makes a POST request to the provided `verify` URL with orderIntentKey to confirm checkout completion.
Request payload: ``` { "orderIntentKey": "string" } ``` Response format: ``` { "data":{ "status": "string", accepted values: "COMPLETED" / "FAILED" } } ``` - Capture (optional): Makes a POST request to the capture URL with `orderIntentKey` and `transactionId` to capture the payment.
This action is optional and will only occur if configured during the addition of the custom payment method.
Request Payload: ``` { "orderIntentKey": "string", "transactionId": "string" } ``` Response: 200 3. The server processes the request and guides the user to either the success page (`successCallback`) or the failure page (`cancelCallback`) by appending the newly created order ID in the URL.
For example, if the successCallback is` https://example.google.com/success`, the server appends the order ID to this URL and directs the user to` https://example.google.com/success?orderid=orderId.`.
App developers can use this `order id` or the `order intent key` to get the newly created order details using [Order](#tag/ORDERS/paths/~1order~1:orderId/get) api ## STEP 6: Finalizing the Order 1. For instant payments, the order will be created and marked as captured after step 5. 2. For delayed payments, the order will created but the capture status will depends on the [PAYMENT_FAILED , PAYMENT_COMPLETED](#tag/CUSTOM-PAYMENTS/paths/~1storefront~1webhook~1payment/post) webhooks. ## Handle Custom Payment refunds When a shop owner initiates a refund request, the server will use the `refundUrl` provided during the custom payment setup, along with the following payload.
``` Method: POST Payload: { "orderId": "string", "amount": "number", //optional "currency": "string" } ``` The payment app developer can utilize this API call to trigger a refund request within the gateway. The server expects that the payment app developer will return a refund ID for this request, which will then be stored in the database for future reference. This refund id can then be transmitted back through the webhook request to facilitate status updates. The expected response: ``` { "data": { "refundId": "string" } } ``` Once the refund request is processed from the gateway side the app developer can use the [REFUND_SUCCESS or REFUND_FAILED webhooks](#tag/CUSTOM-PAYMENTS/paths/~1storefront~1webhook~1payment/post) to update the order status within the system.
Webhooks request format is as below: REFUND_SUCCESS : ``` { "orderId" : "string", "refundId": "string", "event": "REFUND_SUCCESS", "shopId":"string" } ``` REFUND_FAILED : ``` { "orderId" : "string", "refundId": "string", "event":"REFUND_FAILED", "shopId": "string", "failureReason": "string" } ```

id.description: Unique identifier for the custom product

type.description: Type of the product (e.g., PHYSICAL, DIGITAL)

created.description: Timestamp of when the product was created

categories.description: List of categories associated with the product

isNew.description: Indicates if the product is newly created

redirectUrl.description: Redirects user with auth-token to the given url

disconnectUrl.description: URL to receive a notification when user disconnects the app

helpLink.description: Link to help documents for the app

createAccountLink.description: Link to create account page for the app

accessKey.description: Bearer auth token for establishing connection to the app  For more information, see [Bearer Authentication](https://swagger.io/docs/specification/authentication/bearer-authentication/)

configurationEndPoint.description: Link to redirect to configuration end point

isConfigurationRequiredEndPoint.description: To determine whether configuration end point is required

status.description: Set the status of the app as DISCONNECTED. Once disconnected the API token will be invalidated

helpLink.description: Link to help documents for the app

message.description: Message can be plain text or markdown

categoryPageTitle.description: Category page title used for Google indexing

vatNumber.description: Provide countryId incase vatNumber is present

shippingOption.description: If all items are digital or giftcard, you can avoid sending ShippingOption

totalRedeemedValue.description: amount redeemed from all the giftcards applied

vat.description: vat calculated for this order, Can be negative which means When price includes Vat, The Vat has been reversed/exempted.

vatIncluded.description: The vat amount which has been included in the product price

subtotal.description: the cost of all products without any discount applied
The initial subtotal before any discounts are applied.

itemCouponsApplied.description: The subtotal after discounts from item coupons have been applied.

itemAndOrderCouponsApplied.description: The subtotal after discounts from both item and order coupons have been applied.

subtotalAfterDiscount.description: The subtotal values after different levels of coupon application.

subtotalDetails.description: Details of the order's subtotal before and after discounts are applied.

shippingCost.description: the shipping cost for the order without any discount applied

discount.description: total discount applied for the order

total.description: this is the order total with applied discounts and vat

totalDiscount.description: The total amount of discount, which matches the value from an outer context.

percentage.description: The percentage of the discount, to be deprecated as it can be derived from the manual.

couponErr.description: Error message related to coupon application, to be deprecated.

manualDiscountErr.description: Error message related to manual entry or calculation.

applyToType.description: Type of application for the coupon

margin.description: Margin details, e.g., BUY 30 USD / 2 ITEMS more

minimumType.description: Type indicating the minimum criteria for the margin

manual.description: This is the coupon entered by the user during checkout, Currently spports max one coupon of mode CODE

vatRate.description: vat rate considered for this product, could be different from shop vat rate if regional specific vat rate has been specified.

vatIncluded.description: is product price includes vat, then amount of vat already included in the product price. thius value is calculated from the Vat Rate considered

priceIncludesVat.description: does the product/shipping price includes Vat

itemCouponApplied.description: The price after item coupon has been applied.

itemAndOrderCouponsApplied.description: The price after both item and order coupons have been applied.

discountedPricesAfter.description: Prices after coupons have been applied to items and/or the total order.

itemCoupon.description: Discount amount provided by the item coupon.

orderCoupons.description: Discount amount provided by order coupons.

discountBy.description: Details of discounts provided by various types of coupons.

couponPercentageApplied.description: The percentage of the coupon that was applied.

discount.description: The numeric discount value applied from the coupon.

items.description: List of coupons applied along with details about each.

discountDetails.description: Details about the discounts applied, including breakdowns by type and the effect of each coupon.

text.description: The text to display on the ribbon, Only send if isEnabled is true
The text to display on the ribbon, Only send if isEnabled is true

mode.description: The coupon mode. (NOTE: cannot update this field)

The text to display on the ribbon, Only send if isEnabled is true

displayCouponCode.description: Coupon Code to Display on UI

vat.description: Applicable only when voucherType is SPV(single purpose voucher), else this will be ingored

message.description: Message can be plain text or markdown

autoUpdateOrdersReadyForPickup.description: The shipping status for newly placed orders will be updated as Mark as ready for pickup

message.description: Message can be plain text or markdown

isAwaitedForPaymentNotification.description: This field indicates if the order is waiting for the payment approved/rejected notification from payment provider, for example Paypal.

optedInForMarketing.description: This field indicates if the user has opted in for marketing

webhookExpirationInMinutes.description: The maximum amount of time the server should wait before cancelling the order.This value is only applicable to `PAYMENT_FAILED` and `PAYMENT_COMPLETED` webhook events

urls.description: API calls will be made to these URLs during the order creation process. The webshop or payment app developer can utilize these requests to carry out various operations.

capture.description: This URL is optional and is only necessary if the gateway opts to handle payment capture programmatically after the checkout process is completed. The webshop will invoke this API subsequent to its call to the `verify` URL, provided the status returned is `COMPLETED`

checkout.description: Payment app developer can create an intent/order in the gateway

verify.description: During the order creation, the webshop will call this API to check the status of the checkout process.Accepted values are `COMPLETED/FAILED`

refund.description: Will call this api when shop owner make a refund request.Subsequently payment app developer can use this call to create a refund request in payment gateway

dashboard.description: URL to view the payment and order details in payment gateway

paymentIconUrl.description: icon to be displayed on the checkout page
icon to be displayed on the checkout page
icon to be displayed on the checkout page

name.description: Name for shipping option displayed at checkout

ranges.description:
Charge different shipping fees, depending on the total weight of the order. Below conditions must be satisfied for the input,

 - Weight ranges must be an array of continous intervals, i.e. no missing intervals allowed.
 - Weight ranges must not overlap with one another.
 - First interval of weight ranges input must start from 0.

fee.description: A base fee for every order

perItemFee.description: An additional fee for every item in the order
